<p> Transform is a Grouping node that can contain most nodes. Transform translates, orients and scales child geometry within the local world coordinate system. <i>Hint:</i> each transformation creates a new coordinate system relative to the parent coordinate system. </p> <p> X3D Tooltips of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/tooltips/X3dTooltips.html#Transform" target="_blank">Transform</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/Architecture.html" target="_blank">X3D Specification</a> sections of interest: <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html" target="_blank">10 Grouping component</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#Concepts" target="_blank">10.2 Concepts</a> and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/documents/specifications/19775-1/V3.3/Part01/components/group.html#Transform" target="_blank">10.4.4 Transform</a>. </p> <p> <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/X3dResources.html#Examples" target="_blank">X3D Examples Archives</a> of related interest: </p> <ul> <li> VRML 2 Sourcebook:&nbsp; <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter05PositioningShapes" target="_blank">Chapter 05 Positioning Shapes</a>, <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter06RotatingShapes" target="_blank">Chapter 06 Rotating Shapes</a>, and <a href="https://www.web3d.org/x3d/content/examples/Vrml2Sourcebook/Chapter07ScalingShapes" target="_blank">Chapter 07 Scaling Shapes</a> </li> <li> X3D for Web Authors: <a href="http://x3dgraphics.com/examples/X3dForWebAuthors/Chapter03Grouping" target="_blank">Chapter 03 Grouping</a> </li> </ul>
